Hey everyone!. We are using the great tool you guys are working on, but we ran into some issue. I synced my changes to HS but I deleted some content for a global module and I can’t see any history log for that module, is there a way to recover?

Hey Angel - sorry you ran into some trouble. If you update an asset via the local tools, it should just create a new revision as if you updated it in the Design Manager (Actions > Show revision history).
Feel free to DM myself the module and we can take a look

For anyone who is curious, there is a known issue with the Design Manager that we’re working on fixing. The problem is that the revision history is not opening as expected when clicking on “Show revision history” while the “Global and smart content” editor  for a global module is open. The revision history does open fine if on the main module editor view for both normal and global modules.
Thank you <@U6W3H6YN8> <@U22VBL87M>, that worked for us.

Question on functionality of `watch` and `sync`... for each, do they transfer all files from the local directory and overwrite in the Design Manager no matter what, or do they transfer only local files that are modified and newer? And for `watch`, does it attempt to continuously transfer the entire local directory, or does it detect changed files?

Good questions, Doug!

Sync will update/create all files/folders from your local project that are being synced.

Watch will first sync (update/create all files/folders from your local project that are being watched) and then subsequently only update files which are saved (rather than re-uploading all watched files on save of a single file).
